climbs.name: Wild Will's Arete
climbs.fa: Jerry, Sigrid, Lynnea and William Anderson, Aug 1994

content.description: A bit of face climbing leads up to the arete.  Follow the arete up past an intermediate anchor, a corner and finally up the exposed upper arete.  Long and fun. Can be done in two pitches or rappel in two rappels if you don't have a 70m rope.

climbs.name: Ugly, Fat, Mean, Come to Mammoth, Be a Queen

content.description: This excellent 5.7, climbs up stacked blocks, then step left on to an arete, and follow it to the anchors.
content.protection: Nine bolts, double mussy hook anchor

content.description: Start up the right side of the crack and follow the line of bolts up a uneventful slab to the anchors.
content.location:
Right of the broken crack taken by

Bodhisattva

.

content.description:
Start quickly and climb over a bulge onto a slab.   Follow the slab trending left into the corner.   Follow the corner, and when possible step right onto the face.

This face provides the meat of the climb.   The climbing is steep, but the holds are positive all the way to the anchors.
content.location:
Located just right of

Ugly, Fat, Mean, Come to Mammoth, Be a Queen

.

content.description:
Start in the bushy crack, right of

Mobetta Fogetta

, then move right and climb the right wall of a corner. Then through a bulge.
content.protection: 11 bolts and double Mussy Hook anchor

content.description:
Climb the Dihedral to the right of

Chupacabras

.
On the far left of the rock and just left of a bushy crack, climb face to a small dihedral.

climbs.name: Mask Up, Bitches
climbs.fa: Kevander Fox, Kendra Beach, GU Sept 2021

content.description:
Starts right of I-Yam two bolts up detached block to face on right side of upper arete. Climb between face moves and arete. You need a full 70 meter rope. With traffic this will get nicer

Notes: Originally climbed ground up placing bolts in stances, additional bolts were added at a later date and original anchors were changed due to porous rock at the top. This is a new route, loose rocks were removed and ledges were brushed, still, wear a helmet.
content.location: Right of the large chimney start of I-Yam, right-hand side of the arete of I-Yam.

content.description:
Climb the face left of

Ugly, Fat, Mean, Come to Mammoth, Be a Queen

.   The crux is reached near the top, especially if you continue up the face to the anchors.
content.location:
Located left of the arete taken by

Ugly, Fat, Mean, Come to Mammoth, Be a Queen

.

content.description:
vertical pockets

crux is above the 5th bolt

The top of this route makes for a higher, fun, alternate ending to Borrowed From Tradition"

Climb up and clip the first bolt of

Mobetta Fogetta

, then move up and left and follow the line of bolts up to the anchor.

This climb is squeezed into the edge of the cliff, and is easily escaped from by stepping left at a few points.
content.location: Far left side of the cliff.

content.description: A thin start leads to progressively better holds and then a routefinding challenge at the top where it's easy to greatly increase the difficulty. A good thinking route.

climbs.name: Digit Delight
climbs.fa: Jerry, Sigrid, Lynnea and William Anderson, 8/1994.

content.description:
Climb face and a seam past eight bolts, to the right of

Wild Will's Arete

.

This is to the right of

Digit Delight

, and climbs past 8 bolts. Climb on either side of the bolts.

This climb shares the start of "This Ain't No Weenie Roast".   After the 3rd bolt trend rightwards up a finger crack to stance below an arete.

The crux is soon reached as you climb up the left side of the arete.  The first half of this arete has a couple of committing moves.

The climb is spoilt by poorly placed bolts - they seem to be too over to the left.

climbs.name: Borrowing From Tradition
climbs.fa: Jerry, Sigrid, Lynnea and William Anderson

content.description:
Start up the corner clipping the two bolts on the right.    At the second bolt move right on thin face moves until a good hold is reached and vertical progress can be made.

Continue up and follow the exhilarating steep crack above.
content.location:
Climbs the steep wall right of

More Trad Than Rad

.

content.description:
Climb up the left edge of the crack with enjoyable moves, on great rock.

3/4 of the way up step right and follow the twin cracks up to the anchors.
content.location: Climbs the left edge of the obvious crack seen as you walk up to Area 13

climbs.name: A Danger to Ourselves and Others

content.description:
This route is a fun jug hauling romp across Area 13 for when you are just looking for something a little different or simply want the juggy pockets never to end.

It starts on the route

Exqueeze Me

and ends on

Inyo Face

. The pitches are all kept short because of serious rope drag in crossing aretes and traversing alcoves. Because Area 13 is a very popular crag and this route traverses pretty much every route on it, it can only be recommended to be climbed midweek or with utmost consideration for other parties.

Pitch 1

- Starting on

Exqueeze Me

, traverse right and up clipping the 2nd or 3rd bolts of the routes crossed. Aim for the point where the route

Ugly, Fat, Mean, Come to Mammoth, Be a Queen

transfers from the blocky face to the arete. Thin slab climbing (the technical crux) from this point leads up and right to the belay ledge halfway up

Wild Will's Arete

.

Pitch 2

- Stem and flake climbing leads straight up from the belay to a bolt. Traverse right from here around the arete and onto the face. Level traversing around the alcove leads to a couple exciting moves getting to a sloping ledge and the belay for

Borrowing From Tradition

.

Pitch 3

- Level traversing right, moving up where harder, leads to a long right slanting crack. Follow this crack to a large ledge. Belay from the ledge with a gear anchor.

Pitch 4

- Exciting but easy moves off the belay slightly down and right (harder for the follower) leads to easy face climbing trending up and to the right. Belay on a ledge with a horizontal crack just above it. This ledge is located about 5 feet above the anchors for

Demasiado

.

Pitch 5

- Fun juggy face climbing up and right leads to the prominent buttress of

Inyo Face

. Climb this to the top.
content.protection: The protection on this climb is mostly bolts with gear in between routes. The recommended rack is a single rack from .3 to 3, a set of nuts, and 12 draws where at least half of the draws are extendable alpine draws.
content.location:
Start on the far left side of Area 13.

To descend, rappel down Inyo Face or walk off the back.
